intro: Lupinus sericeus var. jonesii, commonly known as the silver lupine, is a perennial flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its silvery-gray foliage and upright, spindly growth habit. The plant produces spicate inflorescences of blue to violet flowers, which bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in rocky or gravelly habitats. Lupinus sericeus var. jonesii is valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to fix nitrogen in the soil.
